title: Wills on Global Migration to Britain MCQ 2

content.question: The argument in the third paragraph regarding the connection between the Partition of India in 1947 and Punjabi migrations to Britain in the 1950s is most directly supported by the author’s claim that

choices.label: more Muslims than Hindus were displaced by the Partition in Punjab, leading to disproportionate numbers of migrants to Britain being Muslim
the Partition was accompanied by large-scale mass violence, leading to significant loss of life
India’s cities were flooded with Punjabi refugees from the Partition seeking economic opportunity there
resettling Partition refugees led to an economic crisis in rural Punjab, leading to further population movements

content.answer: resettling Partition refugees led to an economic crisis in rural Punjab, leading to further population movements

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
